column4: I have a question, I have a new installation of 9.04 which works perfectly fine until I take the computer and plug it into a different network switch, then it refuses to connect to the network or obtain an IP address, if I take it back to the original switch it was installed on it works immediately, any advise ?
are you using DHCP?
yes I am
plug into the the one that does not work, open a terminal and run sudo /etc/init.d/network restart
command not found ?
ups, that should be sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
press tab to invoke auto-completion in terminal, this way you will make sure it's ok
ok it said reconfiguring
ifconfig shows no IP information for Eth0
when you run sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart, it does not say anything about getting a new lease, right?
nope just says reconfiguring network interfaces
nope just says reconfiguring network interfaces
try sudo dhclient eth0
no working leases in persistent database, sleeping. Is the message
so the problem is external. It cannot find a nameserver, so it cannot get an ip address
if I take that network cable out of that machine and plug it into a machine right next to it, it gets a IP address and everything works fine
aha, then it's the machines MAC address. The switch must be somehow rejecting it. Have you tried rebooting the switch?
or looking at its config
I can try that but its a brainless little 5 port hub not even a switch
reset the hub, same thing

the only thing I can think of is the new network applet thingy. It gave me trouble too. Try adding the lines "auto eth0" and "iface eth0 inet dhcp" to /etc/network/interfaces, then kill the applet and do again sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
did you try removing the default config from System->Preferences->Network Connection and adding again a simple dhcp one without the MAC address specified. Maybe it works.
